data.title: Archduke Karl, Duke of Teschen
data.text:
|

Archduke Karl of Austria, Duke of Teschen (Karl Ludwig Johann Josef Lorenz; ; 5 September 1771 – 30 April 1847) was an Austrian field-marshal, the third son of Emperor Leopold II and his wife, Maria Luisa of Spain. He was also the younger brother of Francis II, Holy Roman Emperor. He was epileptic, but achieved respect both as a commander and as a reformer of the Austrian army. He was considered one of Napoleon's more formidable opponents and one of the greatest generals of the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars.

Marriage[edit]

On 15 September/17 September 1815, he married Princess Henrietta of Nassau-Weilburg, in Weilburg.

Issue[edit]

Archduchess Maria Theresia of Austria (31 July 1816 – 8 August 1867) married Ferdinand II of the Two Sicilies and had issue.

Archduke Albrecht, Duke of Teschen (3 August 1817 – 18 February 1895) married Princess Hildegard of Bavaria and had issue.

Archduke Karl Ferdinand of Austria 29 July 1818 – 20 November 1874) married Archduchess Elisabeth Franziska of Austria and had issue.

Archduke Friedrich of Austria (14 May 1821 – 5 October 1847) never married.

Archduke Rudolph of Austria (1822) died in infancy .

Archduchess Maria Karolina of Austria (10 September 1825 – 17 July 1915) married Archduke Rainer Ferdinand of Austria but had no issue.

Archduke Wilhelm Franz of Austria (21 April 1827 – 29 April 1894) never married.

Titles and styles[edit]

5 September 1771 – 30 September 1790 His Royal Highness Archduke Karl of Austria, Prince of Tuscany.

30 September 1790 – 11 August 1804 His Royal Highness Archduke Karl of Austria, Prince of Tuscany, Prince of Bohemia, Prince Royal of Hungary.

11 August 1804 – 10 February 1822 His Imperial and Royal Highness Archduke Karl of Austria.

10 February 1822– 30 April 1847 His Imperial and Royal Highness The Duke of Teschen, Archduke of Austria.

Honours[edit]

Austrian Empire:

Grand Cross of the Military Order of Maria Theresa, in Diamonds, 1793

Kingdom of Bavaria: Knight of St. Hubert, 1844

Empire of Brazil: Grand Cross of the Southern Cross

Kingdom of France: Grand Cross of the Legion of Honour

Kingdom of Prussia:

Knight of the Black Eagle, 4 October 1835

Knight of the Red Eagle, 1st Class

Russian Empire:

Knight of St. Andrew

Knight of St. Alexander Nevsky

Knight of the White Eagle

Knight of St. Anna, 1st Class

Template:Country data TuscanyTemplate:Namespace detect showall Grand Duchy of Tuscany: Grand Cross of St. Joseph

Two Sicilies:

Knight of St. Januarius

Grand Cross of St. Ferdinand and Merit
